name: Goof Troop
summary:
Goof Troop (Japanese: グーフィーとマックス - 海賊島の大冒険 Hepburn: Gūfii to Makkusu - Kaizokujima no Daibouken, "Goofy and Max: The Adventures of Pirate Island") is an action-adventure video game, developed and released by Capcom in 1993 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, and based on the television series of the same name. The game can be played in multiplayer mode, wherein one player controls Goofy and the other Max.
Goof Troop is one of the first games designed by Shinji Mikami, who directed Resident Evil in 1996.
